title: Two European Capitals of Culture in 2026
content:
Two European Capitals of Culture in 2026
holbobe
Tue, 01/06/2026 - 10:18


Oulu
Opening: 16–18 January 2026
Located in the Finnish region of North Ostrobothnia, Oulu built its cultural programme in collaboration with 39 other municipalities to celebrate inclusiveness and cooperation within the European cultural landscape. Oulu 2026 will involve hundreds of artists, creators, and culture profession

title: Moldova officially joins Creative Europe
content:
Moldova officially joins Creative Europe
csudaga
Mon, 12/22/2025 - 16:43


The Republic of Moldova has officially joined Creative Europe, thus becoming the forty-first country participating in the European Union’s flagship programme which supports the cultural and creative sectors.

title: Commission evaluates a decade of Creative Europe
content:
Commission evaluates a decade of Creative Europe
csudaga

The European Commission published the final evaluation of the 2014–2020 Creative Europe programme together with the interim evaluation of the current 2021–2027 programme. title: Commission selects consortium to implement the Simone Veil prize
content:
Commission selects consortium to implement the Simone Veil prize
csudaga
Thu, 12/18/2025 - 09:15


During the Euro-Chanukah celebration on 17 December, Ursula von der Leyen, President of the European Commission, announced that the first edition of the Simone Veil prize will take place in 2026. 
The European Commission has selected a consortium to design and deliver the prize following an open call

title: New report on culture and sustainability in Europe is out
content:

The report “Creative shifts: empowering culture for sustainable living”, written by culture and environment experts from EU countries, highlights greening practices from the cultural and creative sectors.
